titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Bedet Stryker certificate of appointment 1974.152
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:18:35 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: Certificate and of appointment of Bedet Stryker as Coroner of Kings County, New York, dated 1802.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Bedet Stryker certificate of appointment, 1974.152, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The certificate is torn and has a plaster seal attached. Staff should remove the folder from the box with care and open it for researchers. The item should not be moved from its housing.
